titleStmt.title: John, Lizette, & Janette Lee v. Augustus Preuss. Petition for Freedom

bibl.title: Petition for Freedom
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

org.orgName: United States. Circuit Court (District of Columbia)

div2.p: To the Honorable the Judges of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Columbia

The Petition of John Lee, Lizettee Lee, & Janett Lee and Nancy Lee, humbly sheweth, that your Petitioners severally filed their petition for freedom, at the December Term of your Hon. Court for the County of Washington AD. 1820, and that the same are now pending in said Court and undetermined. That your Petitioners are now confined in the common Jail of the County aforesaid at the insistance of a certain Augustus Preuss, and as runaway slaves, and are claimed by said Preuss as his property. That they are apprehensive that before the session of the Court, which commences on the first Monday of May next, the said Preuss will attempt to possess himself of your petitioners and remove them without & beyond the jurisdiction of the Court, and that they are advised that without the interpretation of the authority of the Court to restrain the Marshal of the District of Columbia in from
div2.note: [The rest of this document is missing.]
